title: Sex trafficking survivor is suing Mass. hotels she says turned a blind eye
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “A lot of them know what’s happening, but they just choose to look the other way.
” At Safe Exit Initiative, an organization which helps women seeking to leave the sex trade, Co-Executive Director Audra Doody looks at a wall display of missing women in 2024.
Suzanne Kreiter/The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin October 21, 2025 | 5:09 PM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: What Joe Mazzulla said about rumors of Knicks trying to poach him from Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "There's only team that I want to coach.
That's the Boston Celtics.

" Joe Mazzulla AP Photo/Charles Krupa According to longtime NBA insider Marc Stein, the Knicks spent some time looking into whether or not there was a way they could pry Joe Mazzulla away from the Celtics during the offseason.

title: AG Andrea Campbell launches reelection campaign
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Campbell said that she would continue to stand up to the Trump administration and focus on consumer protection.
Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Campbell.

title: City of Boston declares October 24th ‘Jaylen Brown Day’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics As the Celtics star heads into his 10th season, the city plans to honor him on his birthday.
Jaylen Brown AP Photo/Michael Dwyer Celtics star Jaylen Brown received an early birthday present from the City of Boston.
The city declared that this upcoming Friday, October 24th, will be Jaylen Brown Day in Boston.

title: These New England hotels received Michelin keys in 2025
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel 10 New England properties received two keys and 25 received one key.
A suite at The Langham, Boston.
The Langham, Boston By Kristi Palma October 21, 2025 | 2:41 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Boston lags behind other major cities in return to office, new study finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business While office attendance has reached new post-pandemic highs nationwide, Boston’s recovery remains slow.
A view of the Boston skyline.
David L Ryan/Globe Staff While people are returning to the office nationwide at record levels, Boston is slow to follow, according to a new report.

title: Several big T closures on tap for November
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Transportation The closures will be on the Orange, Green, Red, and Framingham/Worcester lines.
Crews working on the Orange Line in 2019.

title: Bill Belichick is among a dozen candidates for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s 2026 class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Will Bill Belichick make it to Canton next August?

title: Boston officials say new police initiative curbing shoplifting, but more work needed
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business At a City Council hearing, business leaders and police said shoplifting remains a problem in key retail areas.
Stores on Newbury Street removed products from their window displays.
